intro: Cyanea pohaku, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii. Cyanea pohaku has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
